text: The two syllables form a natural greeting with slight tone adjustment.
You should always hold the third tone fully on both syllables.
It is pronounced as a single third tone syllable.
It becomes a question intonation by default.
Asked a question (Nǐ jiào shénme míngzi？)
No — treat it as a fixed greeting (not literal) for beginners.
It is only used in questions.
It is required core HSK1 phrase.
叫我 + 名字 (colloquial) — colloquial, NOT HSK1 core
我是 + 名字 (rare for names)
叫我 + 名字 (colloquial) — colloquial, not HSK1 core
